attributes.background: To give aware to youth about knife crime

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Tackling knife crime in particular localities is a matter for the local police force and local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise the issue of knife crime in your area with a local MP or councillor who represents you.

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP

You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make knife crime prevention a compulsory requirement for all school curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/634860
